com.github.katjahahn.tools.anomalies

Interface SectionTableScanning


  • public interface SectionTableScanning
    Scans the Section Table for anomalies.

      • filteredSymbols

        scala.collection.immutable.List<java.lang.String> filteredSymbols(java.lang.String str)
        Filteres control code and extended code from the given string. Returns a list of the filtered symbols.

        Parameters:
        str - the string to filter the symbols from
        Returns:
        list of filtered symbols, each symbol represented as unicode code string

      • checkZeroSizes

        void checkZeroSizes(scala.collection.mutable.ListBuffer<Anomaly> anomalyList,
                  SectionHeader section,
                  java.lang.String sectionName)
        Checks if SizeOfRawData or VirtualSize is 0 and, if true, adds the anomaly to the given list.

        Parameters:
        anomalyList - the list to add the anomalies to
        section - the section to check
        sectionName - the name to use for the anomaly description

      • checkUninitializedDataConstraints

        void checkUninitializedDataConstraints(scala.collection.mutable.ListBuffer<Anomaly> anomalyList,
                                     SectionHeader section,
                                     java.lang.String sectionName)
        Checks the constraints for the uninitialized data field in the given section. Adds the anomaly to the given list if constraints are violated.

        Parameters:
        anomalyList - the list to add the anomalies to
        section - the section to check
        sectionName - the name to use for the anomaly description

      • checkFileAlignmentConstrains

        scala.collection.immutable.List<Anomaly> checkFileAlignmentConstrains()
        Checks SizeOfRawData and PointerOfRawData of every section for file alignment constraints.

        Returns:
        anomaly list

      • checkObjectOnlyCharacteristics

        void checkObjectOnlyCharacteristics(scala.collection.mutable.ListBuffer<Anomaly> anomalyList,
                                  SectionHeader section,
                                  java.lang.String sectionName)
        Checks characteristics of the given section. Adds anomaly to the list if a section has constraints only an object file is allowed to have.

        Parameters:
        anomalyList - the list to add the anomalies to
        section - the section to check
        sectionName - the name to use for the anomaly description

      • checkReloc

        void checkReloc(scala.collection.mutable.ListBuffer<Anomaly> anomalyList,
              SectionHeader section,
              java.lang.String sectionName)
        Checks PointerTo- and NumberOfRelocations for values set. Both should be zero.

        Parameters:
        anomalyList - the list to add the anomalies to
        section - the section to check
        sectionName - the name to use for the anomaly description
